p: In nature, the probability of getting agarwood-containing Aquilaria trees are extremely low (1â€“2%), where can only be found on pathogenically infected or wounded trees ( Cui et al., 2013; Chhipa and Kaushik, 2017). Therefore, it is sensible to assume that there is a wound-inducible signal transduction process causing the expression of sesquiterpene synthases prior to agarwood formation. In order to clarify the relationship of wound signal transduction and regulation of agarwood formation, high-throughput studies on agarwood formation have recently gained attention in researches ( Table 2).
